attributes.action: Amend Easter pub opening hours in NI so everyone can have a half daycent wee sup
attributes.background: I was out in Portstewart on Easter Sunday and I tried to get a pint after 10pm and my local barman, Jody, informed me that he could not pour me a pint as it would be against the law.  Alas, I shook my head and then realised I would have to go home without that one last pint. It was a long walk home.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it's about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for. This is the responsibility of the Northern Ireland Assembly and Executive.

Although the Assembly and Executive are currently suspended, responsibility has not been returned to Westminster and remains with the Northern Ireland Civil Service. You can contact the relevant department here:

https://www.communities-ni.gov.uk/contact
